intro: Morphixia curta, commonly known as the short morphixia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Morphixia curta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
